body_html:
@weiyangfb Agree. In that vein, things like torch.utils.data.sampler.SubsetRandomSampler also have this extended use where the result is not necessarily a subsample. Perhaps then RandomIndicesSampler or IndicesRandomSampler is more appropriate than SubsetRandomSampler, with a slight change to the docstring about replacement.

In fact SubsetRandomSampler is seemingly quite close to torch.utils.data.dataset.Subset in intent anyway, only it provides indices in random order. So the latter could become something like torch.utils.data.sampler.IndicesSampler to reflect this.

In fact SubsetRandomSampler is seemingly quite close to torch.utils.data.dataset.Subset in intent anyway, only it provides indices in random order.  So the latter could become something like torch.utils.data.sampler.IndicesSampler to reflect this.
body:
@weiyangfb Agree.  In that vein, things like `torch.utils.data.sampler.SubsetRandomSampler` also have this extended use where the result is not necessarily a subsample.  Perhaps then `RandomIndicesSampler` or `IndicesRandomSampler` is more appropriate than `SubsetRandomSampler`, with a slight change to the docstring about replacement.

In fact `SubsetRandomSampler` is seemingly quite close to `torch.utils.data.dataset.Subset` in intent anyway, only it provides indices in random order.  So the latter could become something like `torch.utils.data.sampler.IndicesSampler` to reflect this.
